message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.DB, cs.SI

This paper focuses on the empirical study of blockchain-based decentralized applications (DApps) and their ecosystem. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as DApps are built on top of blockchain technology, which is inherently secure and decentralized. The paper also discusses the patterns of how DApps use smart contracts to access the underlying blockchain, which falls under the category of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Additionally, the paper addresses the issues of deploying and operating DApps, which can be categorized under cs.SE (Software Engineering). The dataset used in the study is also related to cs.DB (Databases), as it involves transaction logs over DApps. Finally, the paper proposes implications for DApp users, developers, and blockchain vendors, which can be considered as a part of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
